intro: Cyperus pohlii var. mendoncae, commonly known as the Mendonca flatsedge, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant typically grows in wetlands, marshes, and other moist environments, often forming dense clumps. Its botanical features include narrow, grass-like leaves and small, clustered flower heads. It is valued for its ability to stabilize soil and provide habitat for various wildlife species.
